artefact: International road freight operators licence (Northern Ireland)

artefact.overview: You need a licence to carry goods (by vehicle) for payment on international journeys
artefact.will_continue_on: the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Northern Ireland (DVLNI) website
artefact.licence_short_description: Licence to carry goods (by vehicle) for payment on international journeys.
artefact.licence_overview: To use a vehicle (with a gross plated weight in excess of 3.5 tonnes) to carry other people's goods for payment on international journeys, you need a licence from the [Driver and Vehicle Licensing Northern Ireland (DVLNI).](http://www.dvani.gov.uk/ "Driver and Vehicle Licensing Northern Ireland (DVLNI)"){:rel="external"}

details.description: Applying for licences from your council for events and businesses
Information about starting up and running a business in the UK, including help if you're self employed or a sole trader.
